textos_fuente.text: Administration Staff | ADC Theatre, Cambridge Site search Go Donate What's On Menu What's On About us Administration History Vacancies Alumni Support us Resident Companies Corpus Playroom ADC Membership Gift Membership and Vouchers Get involved Get Involved Student Applications Involvement in Non-Student Theatre Non-Student Applications Stewarding Technical Acting Directing Producing Comedy Set Design Costume Design Graphic Design New Writing Work Experience Panto 2025 applications Production Consumables Technical Information Equipment Hire Production Resources Report Harassment or Discrimination Theatre Welfare Resources Your visit Booking Information Access ADC Bar Finding the ADC Theatre Finding the Corpus Playroom Education Gift vouchers Help The CUADC/Footlights Pantomime Blog Contact us Brochure Account ( Log In ) Basket ( ) Site search Go Donate What's On Facebook Instagram Twitter LinkedIn Administration The ADC Theatre is one of the smallest departments of the University of Cambridge. We have no academic objective; our main aim is to provide opportunities to learn about and experience theatre. Pravda, Spring 2015 (Photo: Johannes Hjorth) We are a department of the University of Cambridge and the oldest University playhouse in the country. The ADC Theatre is the centre of University drama in Cambridge, led almost entirely by students with no Faculty involvement. We aim to provide opportunities to experience and learn about all aspects of theatre, while presenting professional standard productions. The ADC Theatre has helped to launch the careers of many theatre luminaries, including Sir Ian McKellen, Rachel Weisz and Emma Thompson. We also present shows by local drama groups and touring companies outside of University Term, and are proud to be at the heart of Cambridge's busy amateur dramatic scene. During University Term, we usually present two shows a night: a mainshow at 7.45pm Tuesday to Saturday, followed by a lateshow at 11.00pm. Productions are completely student run, from actors and directors to set designers and carpenters. Members of the CUADC and Fletcher Players sit on the Executive Committee and coordinate and encourage the majority of student activity at the Theatre. The are six permanent staff who provide support and advice as well as running the Theatre day-to-day. To contact a member of the management team, you can email using the format: firstname@adctheatre.com . Alternatively, you can phone the administration line at 01223 359547 during office hours between 11am and 6pm. Photo by Paul Ashley Photography Staff University Theatre Committee Theatre Manager Olivia Wheeler Operations Manager Patrick Nielsen Technical Manager Hugh Bowers Production Manager Stanley Alice Hunt Theatre Administrator Grace Morris Maintenance Technician Darren Thomas-Carr The University Theatre Committee is responsible for overseeing the management of the Theatre and University drama in general (it has taken on the responsibilities of the former University Theatre Syndicate). The Committee approves the Theatre's programme, reviews financial performance, appoints the staff, and sets long term Theatre policy. The Committee is responsible for annually reporting to the University on the financial and material status of the ADC Theatre. Patron HRH The Duke of Edinburgh Chairman of the University Theatre Committee Dr Mark Billinge Executive Committee Members Dr Richard Barnes Dr Sarah Fine Anna Gungaloo Patrick Nielsen Gemma Stapleton Dr Rachelle Stretch Robin Walker Olivia Wheeler Chris Wordsworth Annual Report 2022-23 Records Annual Report 2021-22.pdf 972.9KB Annual Report 2020-21.pdf 981.6KB Annual Report 2019-20 web.pdf 949.0KB 2018-19 Annual Report.pdf 782.0KB 2017-18 Annual Report.pdf 901.3KB 2016-17 Annual Report.pdf 837.4KB 2015-2016 Annual Report inc Accounts.pdf 5.8MB 2014-15 Annual Report and Accounts.pdf 902.3KB 2013-14 Annual Report and Accounts.pdf 1.9MB 2012-13 Annual Report and Accounts.pdf 619.3KB 2011-12 Annual Report and Accounts.pdf 614.5KB 2010-11 Annual Report and Accounts.pdf 85.0KB 2009-10 Annual Report and Accounts.pdf 155.1KB 2008-9 Annual Report and Accounts.pdf 104.0KB 2007-8 Annual Report and Accounts.pdf 118.7KB 2006-7 Annual Report and Accounts.pdf 60.1KB 2005-6 Annual Report and Accounts.pdf 74.2KB 2004-5 Annual Report and Accounts.pdf 307.9KB ADC Theatre, Park Street, Cambridge, CB5 8AS Box office 01223 300085 boxoffice@adctheatre.com Opening times: Monday - Saturday 1 - 6pm Administrative enquiries 01223 359547 hello@adctheatre.com Newsletter sign up Sign up to our mailing list First name Last name Email Sign up Terms and Conditions Audience Code of Conduct Privacy, Security & Cookies Contact us ADC Theatre © All rights reserved 2024
